snippet: The judge said laws the Republican-led Legislature passed in 2014 on absentee or provisional ballots could harm black voters in particular.
abstract: United States District Court Judge Algenon L Marbley blocks provisions in Ohio voter laws that decide how thousands of ballots are counted; says laws are unconstitutional and violate Voting Rights Act.
lead_paragraph: The judge said laws the Republican-led Legislature passed in 2014 on absentee or provisional ballots could harm black voters in particular.

headline.main: Federal Judge Says 2 Ohio Voting Laws Are Unconstitutional
headline.print_headline: 2 Ohio Voter Laws Violate Constitution, Judge Says
